intro: Cirsium roseolum, commonly known as the pink thistle, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its spiny, lobed leaves and striking pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its composite flower heads. Cirsium roseolum typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. Its unique appearance and hardy nature make it a notable species in its native habitat.
